step1.sentence: The team delivered a polished product despite working under an extremely tight deadline.

step2.story: She had always worked best under a tight deadline — the pressure clarified what actually mattered and eliminated the time she would otherwise have spent on second-guessing. What she was less honest about was the recovery cost afterward.

step3.story: The journalism team had forty-eight hours to verify, write, and publish an investigation that had taken three months to develop. The tight deadline was not arbitrary — another outlet was close behind with a similar story. What the deadline compressed was not the thinking, which was complete, but the writing and editing, which had to be done at a pace that made everyone uncomfortable. The piece ran on time. Two minor factual errors slipped through that a slower process would have caught. The corrections were published the next day. Speed and accuracy existed in permanent tension, and the team talked about it afterward, honestly.

meaning.realUsageKo: 여유가 거의 없는 빠듯한 기한을 묘사할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: tight는 여유가 없이 꽉 조여있는 상태를 나타내며, deadline과 결합해 압박감을 표현합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: strict deadline(엄격한 마감)과 유사하지만 tight는 시간적 여유 부족을 더 강조합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We are working under a very tight deadline this week.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이번 주는 매우 촉박한 마감 속에서 작업하고 있어요.
